title: lab
content: i ended up getting 24/25 in my 1st experiment in chemistry as i forgot to write the report,does this mean i cannot get 10/10 in chemistry [lab.how](http://lab.how) will it affect my lab scores?

comments.body:
There are total 10 experiments, even if you get 226/250 you will get 10 
So don't sorry
iirc Chem lab is for a total of 250 marks, so as long as you get above 225/230 you'll get 10/10 for that lab
So these 10 marks will be added to the ISA and ESA and total mark out of 100 will be calculated in chem right?

40 isa , 50 esa , 10 assignment, 10 for lab record , 10 for lab exam 
Total will be 120 , then they will scale it down to 100
Oh i see... so in eng mech/epd it will be out of 100 as there are no labs...
Do we have to write separate record book in chemlab or write in the .manual like physics lab?
